channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Judges order SNAP funding to continue as shutdown threatens food assistance for many Illinois families
item.description: Two federal judges ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown, using contingency dollars if necessary, to ensure that the 2 million Illinoisans who rely on the program can access healthy food.
item.dc:creator: Julian Crews, WGN 9

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Ramen instead of Reese's? Looming SNAP cuts change what's on offer for Halloween trick-or-treaters
item.description: When KC Neufeld announced on her Denver neighborhood’s Facebook page that her family would be handing out ramen and packs of macaroni and cheese in addition to candy this Halloween, she wasn't expecting much of a response.
item.dc:creator: HALLIE GOLDEN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: EA reports decrease in sales, lose content creators amid buyout
item.description: EA has reported a 13% dip in overall sales of $1.81 billion despite significant gains in its Madden NFL and Sports FC franchises.
item.dc:creator: Cher Hwang, NewsNation

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Nation’s largest airlines press Democrats to pass funding stopgap to reopen government
item.description: Four of the nation’s largest airlines are pressing Senate Democrats to pass a clean stopgap spending bill to reopen the government amidst growing delays at airports around the country caused by staffing issues linked to the expiration of government funding a month ago.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: The Latest: Trump wants to scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: FBI stops attack planned for Halloween
item.description: FBI Director Kash Patel says federal officials have arrested multiple people in Michigan who had allegedly been plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Extreme hurricanes have nearly doubled due to warming waters
item.description: Hurricane Melissa was one of the strongest hurricanes on record in the Atlantic. So is that proof that climate change is amplifying hurricanes? The short answer is no. Evidence of climate change requires a much longer record.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Berardelli, WFLA, NBC

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: National Guard in each state is ordered to create 'quick reaction forces' trained in civil unrest
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Military leaders have ordered the National Guard in every state to develop a “quick reaction force” of troops trained to deal with civil disturbances and riots that can be ready to deploy with just hours' notice, the latest indication of longer-term Trump administration plans to mo
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Maryland state senator indicted in alleged scheme involving filming critic in bed
item.description: Federal prosecutors unsealed criminal charges against a Maryland state lawmaker Thursday, accusing her of blackmailing a political critic by secretly recording them in bed with a married man. State Sen.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, WGN 9

item.title: Parents of Nashville school shooting victims fight to keep records out of public view
item.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — The parents of children killed in a shooting at a private Christian school in Nashville are fighting to keep police investigative records a secret, even after many documents were leaked to a conservative media outlet.
item.dc:creator: TRAVIS LOLLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Cruise passenger, 80, found dead on island after ship's crew leaves without her
item.description: The passenger’s daughter Katherine Rees on Thursday accused the cruise company Coral Expeditions of a “failure of care and common sense” that left her mother Suzanne Rees to die alone.
item.dc:creator: Rod McGuirk, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Vance spars with college students at Turning Point USA event
item.description: Vice JD President Vance went toe-to-toe with college students at the University of Mississippi on Wednesday in a nod to his friend and the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, WFLA, NBC

item.title: 5 more arrests made in Louvre jewel heist
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Five more people have been arrested in the investigation into the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre Museum, but the treasures remain missing, the Paris prosecutor announced Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ANGELA CHARLTON and THOMAS ADAMSON Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Judge's order blocking removal of man from US wasn't received until after he was deported, DHS says
item.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Immigration authorities did not receive word of a court order blocking the removal of a man living in Alabama until after he had been deported to Laos, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said Wednesday, dismissing claims that officials violated the order.
item.dc:creator: JIM MUSTIAN and JACK BROOK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: How to find food if your SNAP benefits are cut off
item.description: Unless something changes dramatically in the next couple days, more than 40 million Americans are preparing to have federal food assistance cut off starting Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, Fox 5

item.title: Rosie O’Donnell asks for prayers as daughter faces prison sentence
item.description: Rosie O'Donnell is asking her social media followers for prayers as her daughter Chelsea is facing a prison sentence and “scary future.
item.dc:creator: Celeste Houmard, WGN 9

item.title: Months after a man was killed at a 'No Kings' march, no one has been charged. His wife wants answers
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) — The widow of a beloved Utah fashion designer who was fatally shot during a June “No Kings” protest in Salt Lake City demanded Wednesday that someone be held accountable for her husband's death after more than four months without any charges filed in the case.
item.dc:creator: HANNAH SCHOENBAUM and MATTHEW BROWN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Suspects disguised as construction workers sought in $3.2 million jewelry heist in NYC
item.description: Three people, including two disguised as construction workers, allegedly stole cash and jewelry worth approximately $3.2 million from a home in New York City earlier this month, police said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Fine, WGN 9

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: HORRY COUNTY, S.C. (WBTW) – Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, WGN 9

item.title: White House ousts arts commissioners expected to oversee ballroom, arch construction
item.description: The White House on Tuesday fired the members of the Commission of Fine Arts, a federal agency that advises on architectural developments in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, Fox 5

item.title: SEE IT: 'Hurricane Hunters' capture video in eye of Melissa before turbulence forces them back
item.description: The U.S. Air Force's 53rd Weather Reconnaissance Squadron captured footage of the towering walls inside the eye of Category 5 Hurricane Melissa Monday, before "heavy turbulence" forced them back, the division said in a statement.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, Fox 5

item.title: Florida man executed for the 1998 rape and murder of his neighbor
item.description: STARKE, Fla. (AP) — A Florida man convicted of raping and killing his neighbor decades ago was put to death Tuesday evening in a record 15th execution in Florida this year. Norman Mearle Grim Jr., 65, was pronounced dead following a three-drug injection at Florida State Prison near Starke.
item.dc:creator: DAVID FISCHER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: California, other states sue Trump admin over SNAP benefit cutoff
item.description: California, along with over 20 other states, is suing the Trump administration over its decision not to send out November food assistance as the federal government shutdown continues.
item.dc:creator: Iman Palm, Fox 5

item.title: Maine and Texas are the latest fronts in voting battles, with voter ID, citizenship on the ballot
item.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — Maine’s elections in recent years have been relatively free of problems, and verified cases of voter fraud are exceedingly rare. That’s not stopping Republicans from pushing for major changes in the way the state conducts its voting.
item.dc:creator: PATRICK WHITTLE and JOHN HANNA, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Congress shielded gun companies from lawsuits. Some blue states think they've found a loophole
item.description: HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) — Two decades after a Republican-controlled Congress gave gun manufacturers immunity from being sued over crimes committed with their firearms, blue state Democrats upset about gun violence think they’ve found a way to penetrate that legal shield.
item.dc:creator: SUSAN HAIGH, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Barstool Sports personality Cody 'Beef' Franke dies suddenly
item.description: Popular Barstool Sports internet personality Cody "Beef" Franke has died at the age of 31 after suffering a "sudden medical issue over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, Fox 5
